posts.name: Bekale
posts.cooked:
Hi !

This year, we decided to go with the SDS all Falcon 500 swerve drive. We have been able to drive our drive base until we found out that some motors (both for steer motors as well a drive motors) are producing some “glitches” as you can see here:

Faulty SDS Falcon 500 motors in action

Any idea, please? Thank you

posts.name: snoman
posts.cooked: It seems I am unable to open the link…

posts.name: Bekale
posts.cooked:
Hi @snoman ,

Hope you are doing great. I changed the link to the video showing the faulty SDS swerve Falcon 500 motors in action, please. Can you try the new one, please?

Thank you!

posts.name: snoman
posts.cooked: Is it just one module or are they all doing this?

posts.name: Bekale
posts.cooked: One entire module and one motor on another module are faulty. Motors on the remaining two modules are fine.

posts.name: snoman
posts.cooked: Not a pro by any means. But assuming you are using the SDS code from their Git and everything in the code seems the same, I would start with triple checking CAN wires and make sure the magnetic CAN coders are all acting the same. ( ie. no odd color flashing on the CAN coder). Could try switching a “good motor” to a faulty module to narrow down the cause.  We are running the same setup and have not experienced any issues for the 2hrs or so we have been driving it. What are you using for your gyro? Nav X?

posts.name: Bekale
posts.cooked:
Hi @snoman ,

I use a Navx. I will definitely check the CanCoders too.

Thank you for your feedback.

posts.name: system
posts.cooked: This topic was automatically closed 365 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
